questions.question: What is indicated by a white marker w/ an orange crossed diamond and black lettering?

choices.answer: exclusion or keep-out area, such as a dam
controlled area, such as a no-wake zone
information, such as places to find food
danger or hazard, such as rocks

questions.question: How can you prevent transporting nuisance species w/ your vessel from one waterway to another?

choices.answer: flush vessel engines with contaminated water
run your vessel through vegetation to cut it up
avoid washing your vessel after you leave a body of water
remove any zebra mussels you see before leaving

questions.question: If your inboard/outboard boat runs aground, what action should you take in addition the weight?

choices.answer: stop the engine & lift the outdrive
put the boat in reverse & gun the engine
put the boat in forward & gun the engine
keep the engine running & drop the anchor

questions.question: How do you know when you are operating you vessel at a safe speed?

choices.answer: no other vessels are passing you
you are not overtaking any other vessels
you are going slower than vessels towing skiers
you have enough time to avoid a collision

questions.question: Which action may cause the loss of steering ability in a PWC?

choices.answer: running at maximum throttle
letting off the throttle control
over-steering
under-steering

questions.question: When 2 vessels are operating in the same area, who is responsible for avoiding a collision

choices.answer: the operators of both vessels
the operator of the stand-on vessel
the operator of the give-way vessel
the operator of the smaller vessel

questions.question: What should you do to reduce the risk of falling overboard?

choices.answer: stand up when changing seats
move around while underway
keep two points of contact if you  move
keep centered in the boat

questions.question: Where should your trailer be located while you prepare to launch your vessel?

choices.answer: on your driveway at home
in front of a vessel being launched
in the water at the boat ramp
well away from the boat ramp

questions.question: What should a motorboat operator do when someone is being pulled into the boat from the water?

choices.answer: put the engine in forward gear at the slowest speed
put the engine in reverse gear at the slowest speed
keep the engine idling in neutral
turn off the engine

questions.question: How can propeller strike accidents be avoided?

choices.answer: turn on the engine when passengers are boarding
let passengers ride on the bow while underway
turn off the engine when passengers are boarding
have children watch out for each other

questions.question: Which condition requires that you report a boating accident to the AL Marine Police Division?

choices.answer: your boat breaks down & requires on the water repairs
you witness a boating accident from shore
your boat is stopped & you are arrested for BUI
damage to your boat is more than 2000 from an accident

questions.question: How does the effect of alcohol consumed while boating compare to the effect on land?

choices.answer: about the same effect whether on land or out boating
much greater effect while boating
much greater effect when on land
slightly greater effect when on land

questions.question: What is the first action required of a boat operator who witnesses a boating accident?

choices.answer: to provide assistance
to deep out of the way
to write an incident report
to wait for rescue personnel

questions.question: Which is true about operating a boat in Alabama while intoxicated?

choices.answer: drinking alcohol is not considered to be dangerous
under the influence does not carry penalties fora 1stoffense
operating on ALwaters,a boater must submit to BAC testing
a boater paddling a canoe is less likely to be affected

questions.question: What should a vessel operator do to make sure everyone knows what to do in caseof an emergency?

choices.answer: throw a passenger overboard unexpectedly
explain what to do as an actual emergency occurs
have everyone take a written exam until they can pass it
conduct an emergency drill with the passengers

questions.question: What is the best way to minimize the risk of drowning while boating?

choices.answer: have everyone wear an appropriate life jacket at all times
put on your life jacket after you are in the water
allow only those persons who have passed a swim test
make sure you have a life guard on board your vessel

questions.question: When is a sailboat under sail the give-way vessel when encountering a power-driven vessel?

choices.answer: when the sailboat is crossing ahead from the starboard side
when the sailboat is crossing ahead from the port side
when the sailboat is overtaking the power-driven vessel
when the two vessels are moving in opposite directions

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of careless operation?

choices.answer: displaying navigation lights in the fog
not having enough fuel in the bilges
having personal flotation device that are the wrong color
not having enough personal flotation devices on board

questions.question: What age person who has boater safety certification may operate a PWC w/o supervision?

choices.answer: those at least 17 years of age
those at least 14 years of age
those at least 11 years of age
those at least 8 years of age

questions.question: During what hours is it legal to tow a person behind a boat on water skis or other device?

choices.answer: between 7am and midnight
between sunrise & sunset
between one-halfhour before sunrise&one-halfhour aftersunset
between 1 hour before sunrise & 1 hour after sunset

questions.question: What should you do immediately if a boat motor catches on fire?`

choices.answer: turn the stern of your boat into the wind
shut off the fuel supply&try to put it out w/an extinguisher
abandon the boat & swim for shore
turn on the vent system to remove gas vapors from the bilge

questions.question: What is most important when selecting the right PFD for a passenger?

choices.answer: total number of passengers on board
color of the PFD
passenger's body weight & chest size
passenger's age & gender

questions.question: What effect does alcohol have when you are operating a vessel?

choices.answer: makes it easier to pay attention
helps you perform multiple tasks
helps you avoid dehydration
increases the likelihood of accidents

questions.question: What is the best way to find out about hazards on a local waterway?

choices.answer: consult a nautical chart
consult a topographical map
ask someone who went there last year
listen to your favorite radio station

questions.question: Which of these provides a warning that dangerous weather is approaching?

choices.answer: clear, sunny skies & no wind
drop in wind speed & calm water
white clouds & gentle waves
dark clouds & shifting winds
